titleStmt.title: W. F. Camden to James F. Robinson
CWG14052

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

body.p:
Waynesburg nov 13th 1862
To the Military Govner of the State of Ky
Dear Sir

I want the permission from you to make up a company of 60 men in the county of Lincoln and State of Kentucky my object is to put down theiving tha are braeking in to Stores in this place and Kneghbours Houses and stealing negroes and in fact all kind of depedatians now i prpose to have these men A and we dont want to takx the Goverment with Horses will We will ride our on when Nessesary but we would properly want Some guns and ammunition and i would Like for your Honor to instruct me what to do and how to manage the cause if you permit me to Rais said company if i rais Said company it will be of old men and and can get them in 24 Hours please to me a mediately Respectfully your obediant servant

Waynesburg Ky,
Nov. 13/62
Camden W. F.
Authority to raise troops to protect his region.
asked to raise men in Lincoln
